cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 180 mi NNE of Veracruz, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the western Gulf, then slowing and turning northward toward the south-central Texas coast Monday night into early Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Texas coast (near Matagorda Bay/Port O’Connor area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Port Aransas to High Island Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port Aransas Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from the Rio Grande to High Island, including Galveston Bay, with additional impacts expected into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft forecast for Galveston Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 mph, gusts 50+ mph) possible late Monday night through Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in Galveston Bay and adjacent coast, including Texas City dike area
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches, leading to flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; hazardous seas and possible channel restrictions for vessel traffic
